description: A schema for representing certificates on the blockchain
title: Blockchain Certificates Version 1.2 Schema

_88JsonLdContext.description: A link to a valid JSON-LD context file, that maps term names to contexts. Blockchain Certificate contexts may also define JSON-schema to validate Blockchain Certificates against. In a Blockchain Certificate Object, this will almost always be a string:uri to a single context file, but might rarely be an array of links or context objects instead. This schema also allows direct mapping of terms to IRIs by using an object as an option within an array.

$eref.description: The complete certificate document, including the assertion, certificate, and issuer. Doesn't include the blockchain receipt. This part is hashed and placed on the blockchain
$eref.title: Certificate Document Version 1.2 Schema

_88VerificationObject.description: V1.2 notice: the Blockchain Certificates VerificationObject will change in the next schema version to be consistent with OBI VerificationObjects. This work is in progress.

___signer.description: URI where issuer's public key is presented. Default is https://[domain]/keys/[org-abbr]-certs-public-key.asc. V1.2 change: this field is optional

___type.description: Name of the signing method. Default is 'ECDSA(secp256k1)', referring to the Blockchain Certificates method of signing messages with the issuer's private key.

___attribute-signed.description: Name of the attribute in the json that is signed by the issuer's private key. Default is 'uid', referring to the uid attribute.

___identity.description: String that represents a recipient's identity. By default, it is an email address.

___givenName.description: Given name of the recipient. http://schema.org/Person#givenName

___type.description: Type of value in the identity field. Default is 'email'.

___hashed.description: Describes if the value in the identity field is hashed or not. We strongly recommend that the issuer hash the identy to protect the recipient.

___revocationKey.description: Issuer revocation key for the recipient, optional. Bitcoin address (compressed public key, usually 24 characters) of the recipient.

___salt.description: per the OBI standard, if the recipient identity is hashed, then this should contain the string used to salt the hash

___familyName.description: Family name of the recipient. http://schema.org/Person#familyName

___publicKey.description: Bitcoin address (compressed public key, usually 24 characters) of the recipient. V1.2 change: renamed from pubkey

_88JsonLdType.description: A type or an array of types that the Blockchain Certificate object represents. The first or only item should be 'CertificateDocument', and any others should each be an IRI (usually a URL) corresponding to a definition of the type itself. In almost all cases, there will be only one type: 'CertificateDocument'

A type or an array of types that the Blockchain Certificate object represents. The first or only item should be 'BlockchainCertificate', and any others should each be an IRI (usually a URL) corresponding to a definition of the type itself. In almost all cases, there will be only one type: 'BlockchainCertificate'

$eref.description: Provides evidence of the certificate on the blockchain, using the chainpoint v2 standard
$eref.title: Blockchain Certificates Receipt Schema, Version 1.2

___type.description: type of hash. Currently the only supported hash type is SHA256, with chainpoint type ChainpointSHA256v2.

___anchors.description: how the proof is anchored to the blockchain

___type.description: type of anchor, e.g. BTCOpReturn. Currently the only supported value is BTCOpReturn.

___sourceId.description: How to lookup the proof on the blockchain. Currently this is expected to be the (value of the) Bitcoin transaction id, and this value format is validated accordingly

___@context.description: This should always be chainpoint v2 JSON LD context

___merkleRoot.description: Merkle root value -- this is anchored to the blockchain. Currently the only supported hash type is SHA256, and merkleRoot format is validated accordingly.

___targetHash.description: hash of item being verified. Currently the only supported hash type is SHA256, and the targetHash format is validated accordingly.

___proof.description: how to walk the Merkle tree from the target item to the Merkle root

___right.description: value of right neighbor to combine into parent hash. Currently the only supported hash type is SHA256, and this value format is validated accordingly.

___left.description: value of left neighbor to combine into parent hash. Currently the only supported hash type is SHA256, and this value format is validated accordingly.
